title: How to Install a Teamspeak Server on Windows

steps.headline: Click on the site to download "Teamspeak Server"
Here you will see a list of different versions of TeamSpeak Client and Server.
Read the TeamSpeak End User License Agreement.
Click 'I AGREE' at the bottom of the page to continue.
Click Run when prompted with the next two screens.
When asked if you would like to install TeamSpeak 2 Server, click 'Yes.'
The setup wizard will be displayed, click 'Next' to continue.
The License Agreement screen will be shown.
Select 'I accept the agreement' and click 'Next.'
You will then be prompted to select a folder directory to install the server in
Select a folder to install the application in, and click 'Next'.
steps.description:
For most users, the default location is recommended. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3e\/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-12Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3e\/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: You will then be prompted to select a folder to put the shortcuts in and then click 'Next' to continue.
steps.description:
For most users, the default location is recommended. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/29\/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/29\/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: The wizard will then ask if you would like to create an icon on the desktop.
Click Install to begin the install process.
Read the information about TeamSpeak Server and click Next.
The setup wizard will then be finished.
TeamSpeak Server is now installed on your machine.
steps.description: If you selected to launch TeamSpeak, you will see an icon running in the lower right bottom of your screen.

text:
Search for a "Teamspeak Server" download Click on the site to download "Teamspeak Server" Here you will see a list of different versions of TeamSpeak Client and Server. Find the Windows downloads section. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/37/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/37/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Find the TeamSpeak Server. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b3/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Start downloading. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/69/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Read the TeamSpeak End User License Agreement. Click 'I AGREE' at the bottom of the page to continue. Click Run when prompted with the next two screens. When asked if you would like to install TeamSpeak 2 Server, click 'Yes.' The setup wizard will be displayed, click 'Next' to continue. The License Agreement screen will be shown. Select 'I accept the agreement' and click 'Next.' You will then be prompted to select a folder directory to install the server in Select a folder to install the application in, and click 'Next'. For most users, the default location is recommended. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-12Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3e/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-12Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} You will then be prompted to select a folder to put the shortcuts in and then click 'Next' to continue. For most users, the default location is recommended. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/29/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The wizard will then ask if you would like to create an icon on the desktop. If you would like to create an icon on the desktop, leave Create a desktop icon checked and click Next. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-14Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-14Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/c9/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-14Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If you would like to not create an icon on the desktop, uncheck Create a desktop icon and click Next. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-14Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-14Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fa/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-14Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Click Install to begin the install process. Read the information about TeamSpeak Server and click Next. The setup wizard will then be finished. If you would like to launch TeamSpeak right away, Click Finish. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-17Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/6b/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If you don’t want to launch TeamSpeak right away, uncheck Launch TeamSpeak 2 Server, Click Finish. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-17Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-17Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/84/Install-a-Teamspeak-Server-on-Windows-Step-17Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} TeamSpeak Server is now installed on your machine. If you selected to launch TeamSpeak, you will see an icon running in the lower right bottom of your screen.
